item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Looks Good Enough for some excersize.

As Always, everything depends on the weather conditions and the depth-type of snow expected at the site..

------------

If the depth of snow above 5 or so inches on the ground Northwest Park will

rent out the Ski or Sno Shu equipment if you do not have your own.

It is free to use the park's trails if you have your own equipment and no minimum snow depth restrictions.

 

--------------------------------------

I will be wearing my BRIGHT ORANGE HUNTING HAT near the ski Sno Shu rental area

(AKA The WARMING SHACK)

-------------------------------

Potluck details will be worked out closer to the day of the event or while skiing (depends on the amount of interested people too.)

Options are:

1) my  home --- Remember i have badd parking areas and snow makes it even harder or another members home ??.

2 ) even though i do not like restaurants, the Chineeze Buff-a is only 5 bucks or so, its a last resort option and we ask to Have the TIGER ROOM in the back if its available.. or other place..

3) or- ya all go home afterward.

-------------------

Getting to North West park:

Home | Contact Around Northwest Park
Here you'll find information on getting around Northwest Park. Take a look at our trail maps, find directions, and then click to find some Frequently Asked Questions (and answers!) about Northwest Park! 

Trail Map

Click here to download our new, full-color trail map in PDF format for printing, shown here in smaller scale:

 

 

Directions to Northwest Park

Northwest Park is open daily, dawn to dusk and there is no admission charge.

The Nature Center and Gift Shop are open Monday through Saturday, 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. and often on Sunday, but call (860) 285-1886 for Sunday hours.

The park is located in Windsor, Connecticut, USA. From Interstate 91 heading north, take Exit 38. From Interstate 91 heading south, take Exit 38A. Turn right at the exit on to Poquonock Avenue (Route 75). Go about 1.5 miles and turn left on to Prospect Hill Rd. Turn right at the traffic circle on to Lang Road and continue up the road to the Nature Center.

While at the Park...

Also visit the Luddy-Taylor Connecticut Valley Tobacco Museum on the grounds of Northwest Park!
